block.p: From Lebanese Grapes

Ralph Hochar, the winemaker and owner of Chateau Musar in Lebanon, will pour his wines tomorrow at Bacchus Wine Made Simple, 2056 Broadway (71st Street). One-hour tasting segments, $10, will start at 6 p.m.: bacchusnyc.com or (212) 875-1200.
Children, Eating: A Forum
Baum Forum will hold a conference on food for schoolchildren on Saturday from 9:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. at the Graduate Center at the City University of New York, 365 Fifth Avenue (34th Street).
Admission is $35, including lunch ($20 for students, and no charge for those under 18). Registration: (212) 817-8215 or baumforum.org.
Rhymes With Devil's Food

Cakes with poetic themes made by pastry chefs including Deborah Lauren of City Sweets and Pierre Reboul of Blaue Gans will be on display on Saturday from 5 to 7 p.m. at Poets House, 72 Spring Street (Lafayette Street), to celebrate the center's 20th anniversary. Admission is free.
Middle-Age Spice

Spices in medieval cooking will be the topic of a talk by Paul Freedman at a meeting of the Culinary Historians of New York on Monday at 7:30 p.m. at the National Arts Club, 15 Gramercy Park South. Tickets are $25 for members, $35 for nonmembers: (212) 334-1061.
Can't Get Service?
A panel discussion about customer service at restaurants and shops will be held on April 6 at 5 p.m. at the Artisan Baking Center, 36-46 37th Street in Long Island City, Queens. Admission is free.
FLORENCE FABRICANT
